text:
Came here for a friend bday celebration, this place is beautiful not to far from the strip prices are affordable food is amazing !!
Has a big variety of beers as well live music such a cool chick place go to with family or a date

My experience was amazing!  Our waiter, Josh, was friendly, courteous, and speedy.  He was on top of everything and really took care of us.  I can't say enough about the service we received.  Let's talk about the food.  The food was amazing!  Delicious, and flavorful, the prices are great as well.  Most things on the menu don't break the 15 dollar mark.  The quality for what you pay for is awesome.  We had an opportunity to meet Chef Mo.  He is hilarious and friendly, even if he is a Philadelphia Eagles fan.  (I'm a Falcons fan).  All in all our experience was top notch.  The decor is modern and stylish, everyone is friendly, the food is delicious and the dessert is out of this world!  If you are anywhere near the Orleans, visit this restaurant.  It will be worth it.  Well done Bailiwick!
Awesome dinner for nearly 40 people group. Food was good. Food was fast. Servers and host manager gave great service and were fun. What more could you ask for?? I'll be back.
What a hidden gem in The Orleans! Make time to go to this place. Service was fantastic. Phenomenal food and drinks! Great atmosphere! They're doing it right. Thanks guys!

Will I was over eating at all the fast food places in the Orleans cafeteria area, so I decided to try Bailiwick. Arrived at the restaurant and there was about 6 others eating at the location so I figured service would be pretty good. Ordered a beer which took forever due due the bartender attempting to flirt with the two twenty year old females sitting at the bar. Bartender finally served my beer and it sat there for another ten minutes as the waitress was no where to be found. 

Finally my beer arrived to my table which I have to say was pretty good tasty!! 

Food came out and was extremely tasteless and barely warm.  I'm not the type to complain and l was in a hurry. 



I'll never be returning to the location again gave it a two star due to the good music they had playing and the beer tasted great!!

A friend suggested Bailiwick and I am SO glad we went here, what an awesome find!!! The food and service are superb! I had a beer from the bar come to find out, it was on special, so I had a few more. They have awesome specials. For an appetizer we all shared the garlic fries....woah...delish! For the entrée, I had the fish and chips....by far, the best around! 
   Coupled with the great live music and the atmosphere, Bailiwick is the place to go! They even have games to play such as pool and others! 
   I will definitely be returning to this place in the near future and now I have another place to suggest for my friends and out of town visitors!
Good beer selection. Went here due to them having Atomic Duck beers on draft.  Those were awesome.  Had the buffalo sliders,  which were ok. Also tried the french toast sliders, those were good.

Fish & chips $18.  The little lettuce & pea salad that came with it was very good.
Bbq chicken flatbread was tasty $11.
Garlic fries had a mild garlic taste but very strong smell $8.
Fabulous live band.
The portions are generous.
Nice ambiance.

This place was a exquisite twist to a Bar/Restaurant. With the look of your modern day burger hub, its menu features a wide variety of selections which all have a healthier approach that doesn't substitute flavor in least. The projection TV is in perfect view from anywhere and has more privately placed tables as well. Japanese tacos were a fresh kick to the sushi seared taco. Ordered the black bean burger and was blown away at how much flavor it had with the black beans and sriracha cream. Highly recommend Jhazmin she was great!

Amazing food. Great service and awesome atmosphere. Great spot to bring friends. The pretzel is perfect for sharing. Also had the fish & chips and Rueben egg roll. Went on a Saturday about 5 pm. Got to hear some live music. Found a new regular spot.

Let me start with the great part. Fish and chips. They were halibut vs. cod, which I greatly prefer and they were gop! The batter on the fish was well made and cooked nicely. The staff seemed to be bothered by us and other guests. Place was empty.
Once we finally got our drinks, they were solid. This place could be something if the service was better.

Everything was great! The service, the food, drinks, atmosphere...everything. Wendy was super attentive and delightful to have as a server, taking her time to talk with us and even remember our drink orders when we returned the next day. The food came out swiftly and was delicious. The drinks were on point. We felt comfortable and enjoyed every minute of our time spent here. 

Go on a Saturday, early evening, for some live music during Happy Hour that starts at 4pm.

Excellent food, service and atmosphere!! I highly recommend bailiwick.  Jaynee (Bailiwicks manager) knows her staff and has great entertainment. Try the brussel sprout salad or Halibut fish and chips!
Great service by Tia.  She was very attentive without being overbearing.  The food and beer was good.

Economically responsible but still a very creative menu makes this a very good place to grab a bite and listen to some good music. The food is very high quality and the staff is very friendly and professional. The decor of the place is very hip but not funky...and the manager jaynee pogline is attentive  knowledgeable of the menu and very pleasant. They also have areas to shoot pool and watch games. So if your looking for a place to chill have great food thats not hars on the wallet i highly suggest Bailiwick at the orleans

Bar was cool and they had a good playlist which created a good atmosphere. The staff was horrendous, out servers priorities and time management skills were way off. The manager was drunk (or seemed inebriated) and made a fool of herself. We were told the bar was slammed, but there were 2 bartenders for about 5-10 people at the bar. My only suggestion is to start watching your staff and working with them on ticket management from taking an order all the way through final bill presentation.

We had burgers and drinks from this bar/restaurant. Bailiwick's had two pool tables and a shuffle board that came with unlimited use as long as the bill was over $25. We had a great time and our server John was awesome. We will definitely be stopping here again on our next trip back.

Great food, beer and service!  For Vegas standards it was a good deal for high quality food.  Our bartender made some great local beer selections!  My only complaint is the cigarette smoke drifting in from the casino but really that has nothing to do with the place itself.  We stay at The Orleans at least once a year and will for sure come in on the next trip!

We loved finding this restaurant while here for a basketball tournament. We have gone twice and loved the fish and chips, tuna tacos, and Brussels sprouts salad. But the favorite thing, so far, was the donut holes with dipping sauce. Add the great, friendly service and you have 5 stars.

The food and atmosphere are awesome here. There were some creative drinks that tasted great, especially the coco loco. However, the service was awful. We got the most attention from a busser who took our initial drink order when we were waiting on others and came back a few times to check on us. The server, Ashly, was inattentive and not knowledgeable about anything on the menu. She also had horrible time management and a bad attitude. Everything took forever and she had no sense of urgency. When asked about drinks on the menu her reply was that she doesn't drink here. Our drinks were left at the bar until someone else finally brought them to us. One drink didn't come with the others and when asked she said it was at the bar and she'd be back. She then brought drinks to other people and we watched her talk to multiple other tables until bringing the drink which she then apologized for saying the bartenders were slammed even though there were two of them and the restaurant was not very busy. The manager came to help change the channel and seemed to be inebriated and was very unprofessional towards us giving us some attitude about the baseball game we wanted on. In general the staff all seemed pissed off about being there and like us being there was burdening them in some way. Overall this restaurant would be much better if the staff had had better attitudes and learned time management. The concept is great and would be an awesome place to go to.

I am blown away by Bailiwick!!!!!

FOOD: Honestly, couldn't have ask for a better menu. Everything ordered was made to perfection. The grilled cheese sliders with tomato soup is amazing! I highly recommend! Their burgers have a surprisingly tasty and moist hamburger patty. Their toffee cake dessert is delicious and served with ice cream.

DRINK: They have a bar that's great to grab a drink and socialize. They carry many unique beers.

ATMOSPHERE: They have a live band performing, shuffle board, beer, food, and great staff. Couldn't ask for more! Love the decor of the restaurant.

Food portion was a lil small with the french toast and chicken order the size disappointed me, But the pretzel on the size was HUGE and filled us up so that made up on the main meal. The house club sandwhich was great as well nice and big. The atmosphere was great overal all, good customer service too!

This is my second time at Bailiwick and I had a wonderful time yet again. Staff was great, food was great, live music was awesome. Chef Mo came out to talk to us after an odd request we had, and was very understanding. As a local in Vegas it's nice this place doesn't treat you like a tourist. 10/10 will be back

Love this place. What a gem inside of the Orleans Casino. Live acoustic music played at the perfect volume...and the guy singing was great. Happy hour from 4-6pm. And really fun menu. Our favorite was the Reuben eggrolls...soooo good! They are on the happy hour menu too. The decor is hip and inviting. And they have a pool table and shuffleboard. Our bartenders were super down-to-earth, friendly and generous! I also liked how there was no gaming and smoking. It's hard to find a place like that in Vegas anymore!

Wow, Bailiwick is my new favorite restaurant! Excellent service (thx Joseph for a great night), food was awesome, environment was fantastic, live music was entertaining and the games were really fun. I would absolutely give Bailiwick 5 stars and recommend anyone looking for a new HOT spot to try here.

What a hidden new gem in the orleans! We stopped by after an afternoon of gambling to get some drinks and dessert. We got a beer flight.. great selection and delicious porters! 
Their desserts are perfectly crafted and not too sweet! Would highly recommend the toffee cake and the key lime cheesecake!

It was pretty dead so we walked in and sat at the bar. It took about 5 minutes to get waited on but after that they were attentive and friendly. 

The weekend happy hour has changed again. Now it's 4-6. Missed out on that. Started with the fish tacos which are a seared tuna. Absolutely delicious. After that the rest went downhill. Got the Bailiwicked Shrimp and Not Your Nachos. The shrimp were over cooked and the sauces were nothing 
special....just a regular honey mustard, a sriracha mustard, & cocktail sauce. The nachos were terrible. It was like they took all their leftover chips & through them together. There were pepper chips, salt & vinegar, and plain. The ghost pepper cream had no heat to it at all & overall the whole
dish tasted like seasoned salt. We ate it but shouldn't have. Both of us complained about it to each other the whole time but still ate it...,,terrible mistake!

If we would have stopped at tuna tacos I'd probably go back. Unfortunately we did not & will not return.

Their brunch was off the charts delicious! Had the classic bacon and egg plate. (No pic of before as it was that good) Perfectly cooked over-easy eggs with Yukon potatoes and thick slices of bacon and not one thing on the plate was greasy. The food along with a Bloody Caesar with a hint of spice was a great combination. Love the decor and the feel of the place! Definitely coming back for dinner!

Amazing? Yes, Yes, Yes. The atmosphere is trendy but comfortable, with live music and cozy seating. The staff is prompt friendly and great at creating a fun experience. I came in during happy hour and took advantage of the specials. I had the short rib stew, it's served with jalapeño pancakes ( sounded strange to me to).. The stew was delicious and the pancakes were an excellent compliment to the stew. When you come in ask for Jasmine, she won't let you down. 

Cheers

My sister and I and a friend came here to check on the casino and we got hungry so we decided to try this place out after looking at the menu I decided to go with the burger I wasn't expecting it to be good but I was wrong it was delicious I wish they would give you more chips ..  but for 10.00 it was cheap and tasty.

Bad customer experience. Bottom line. Won a gift card with a very short expiring date. My wife called and spoke to management and they said it was OK to use if we planned to come at a later date.  She spoke to Karina who said her manager Joe said it was OK extend it. This was because we didn't know when we were returning to Vegas. We really wanted to use for the dinner menu since that was the only good part that looked good. But everytime we had been in Vegas or were ready to redeem the GC they were either closed or had only there appetizers menu. Today we finally came in and by chance it was the last day to use but we were not hungry.  We had eaten at another hotel hours earlier since we did not want to wait til 4pm and we were completely hungry at check out 12 noon.  Somehow we made it over to orleans after completing our business and to gamble at our usual tables. After we finished we were still not hungry so we said let's stop by baliwick to confirm that we can extend the use of the gift card. We met the manager Joe to confirm if we can extend the use of the gift card for a later date and he suddenly changes his story from what he told my wife and said today is the deadline and we can extend until Monday.  Then he started rambling on about how he is hungry and some other weird dialogue. I had to stop him and correct him  and asked him what does that have to do with me? Suddenly he snaps out of his weird talk. Despite the efforts to explain in plain English that we tried in good faith to use but they were either closed or pass the dinner menu which ends at 10pm.  Somehow the other manager TJ tried to say that if you were hungry you should of just used it and get the appetizers.  Again we explained we don't live in Vegas and we come when we can. We really wanted to try the food and of course if it was great we would add them to our list of places to eat other then TGIF at orleans and other places in Vegas. In the end it was not worth fighting over $50 and we gave the gift card to a group of women that were celebrating at the bar. I sincerely hope they got to benefit and enjoy the GC where we could not. It was the principle of offering the gift card as it was like an invitation to come try them out. Some how it looks like Joe doesn't look to happy there and he was hanging by the corner looking down and out. I dont want to repeat what my wife said about him and the situation. BTW. The place does not look to busy and I can maybe guess why. Looks like they are bleeding money here. These folks were so nice when they gave out the GC but there attitude changed when it came time to use the card or tried to use. Again my concern is the management who should have tried to make it right instead of there poor excuses or trying to force us to eat when we were not hungry.  Our concern is not the food or drinks which I'm sure are great.  Bottom line they earned two less customers who are regulars at the Orleans and numerous Vegas events.  Not sure if this review will help others in there research for a great place to eat or not. I highly doubt we will hear from the folks at baliwick since there's nothing else to say.

Very comfortable, gastropub fare. Excellent staff, and live music, no problems with any of the food. Our server was Nina, she was very good. We also spoke with a manager checking in on us, Janna(?) She was sincere and truly cared about us and our experience. I would definitely recommend this place to our friends!

Place is AMAZING, great addition to the Orleans.

The Chef has gone outside the box and put some great twist on classics, while keeping plenty of familiar items for all. Great for sharing!

Around 40 beers on tap and a ton of bottles including limited editions and a 3 liter.

Cool lounge area with private seating, pool, shuffleboard and a stage with music nightly.

Parking and access are super easy.

I seriously did not know what to expect. 11 reviews and 5 star rating but they only had been open for a short time. I decided to give them some attention from the yelp community and load up their page with pics because it was lacking. 

TVs galore. This is an awesome spot to grab a bite, some drinks, and watch some sports. Every seat has a decent view. 

The service is spectacular. Michelle our server was awesome! She made sure we were well taken care of. She had knew the menu well and made several drink and food recommendations. I appreciated having her work with us for the evening.  

Since this place is new it wasn't too busy. I think this place is perfect for the locals and for those of you who like to venture off the strip. Inexpensive and great eats. The food is well priced; ranging from $8-$20 from appetizers to plates. Menu is simple. I suggest sharing the appetizers. 

I definitely will return. As a matter of fact I may go back tonight because there is a Kids tyme (kids daycare at Orleans). Great place,  cool concepts and aesthetically pleasing. Happy drinking/eating!

This is the latest restaurant renovation inside the Orleans. It's an upscale bar / restaurant with modern industrial style in the menu that has enough comfort food to be good, enough twists to be interesting, and not so pretentious or expensive that you wouldn't just drop in for lunch or dinner.

Loved the live music. They were very talented musicians, however if you want to have any kind of conversation, ask specifically for the dining room. If they put you in front of the stage, you won't be able to hear yourself talk.

The prices are solid mid-range. Everything we ordered was fresh, not just reheated frozen like at a chain restaurant. The portions were big, but other than a pile of pasta that we saw sailing by, nothing appeared to be overly supersized. The quality of food is excellent for the price.

We can also vouch that all the barrel aged cocktails are excellent, although each is distinctly different.  The old fashioned was our favorite, and the Blood & Sand was a pleasant surprise. The Manhattan was also very good, it just happened to come in 3rd out of 3. 

They had nice pool tables and sports screens everywhere. We were impressed enough to already talk about coming back. 

Our server Ashley was excellent.  From the initial drinks through appetizers, dinner and dessert cocktails, she was great. Always there when we needed her, and didn't get in the way of our conversation.

One thing one comes to expect in Vegas is quality- especially taking into consideration the price of dishes. Bailiwick fell extremely short of this expectation. I ran in with a group of friends for a quick bite, ordered a basic dish, chicken wings, only to find once the food was received, there were chicken feathers still attached to the chicken wings. Upon asking our waitress (who did a very good job serving us) how chicken feathers could be still attached to the wing, was told they receive their battered chicken from an outside party. The basic premise of a fried wing is extremely simple, leading me to ask- why outsource that duty to a third party, especially for the price of the dish to know it wasn't fresh. This restaurant did not live up to my basic expectation of fresh, properly prepared food. I would not recommend this as a quality place to eat, and should not have a place in the arena of Vegas restaurants.

Food is very good. However the service is dreadful. It amazing that those reviews by new reviewers rave about the service. Are they dining at the same restaurant?

Both dinners were during slow times for the restaurant. 5:00 during the week. 

The first time I asked for the aioli for the burger to be served on the side. It came dry with no sauce. The runner dropped the food and left. I flagged the server and she told me that the pesto coming with my husband's burger was the aioli. Really?  Obviously she didn't want to go to the kitchen to get it. She also knew nothing about the wines and was not willing to get answers.

The second time (different server) we ordered apps and mains. Everything arrived at the same time. Our dumber than a doornail server said that we didn't request them to be delivered separately! Good thing we didn't order dessert or that would have come out too.

I had a 4 Star review pending on here until my most recent visit knocked it down to a 2 Star.
It's not a one star because the first time that I went my food was actually good. Service was sheer shit, just as it was this time around. Weird...both times involved a RBF waitress. This last time I didn't even get to eat. They were sure to remind me that the kitchen closed as a "courtesy" but they did it a few times. After confirming they they would in-fact serve us food, they also tried to talk us into sitting at the bar. We were clearly an inconvenience. So we left.
Great service! Loved the room. Our waiter John was great! Chicken sliders were amazing

Most restaurants in the casinos are hit or miss, and this one is a hit. A creative & delicious menu from the bar and the kitcken. With plenty of TV's, pool, and a lounge area, this is a great spot to enjoy the evening.

Food was excellent, had fish and chips. More than I could eat. Service was poor at best, wait staff never asked how our food was, we had to summons her twice to the table. She still acted as she didn't care. Never asked if I wanted another beer? Or wine for my wife? At a pub? Went on a Tuesday night not busy at all.  Better service would have made this experience great.

I was ready to give this place 1 star but Bones did a wonderful job making up for his coworkers horrendous customer service. 

I was in Vegas for work and wanted a place to have a few drinks without having the congestion of the strip. Upon my arrival, I wasn't greeted by the server. I think his name is Bill - a big guy with no personality whatsoever. I asked for a beer recommendation and he gave me the most awful beer ever. He never offered the food menu and never asked how I was doing or if I need another drink (it wasn't busy at all). Luckily for me, he left after 20 minutes and Bones replaced him. Bones was the complete opposite. We conversed about different beers and I was able to get some food  (finally). 

I will definitely go back but if Bill is there, I will walk out.

Not sure why I haven't reviewed Bailiwick before, as we've been here a number of times. Obviously, we continue to enjoy our visits as we keep coming back for more!

We first discovered this pretty pub while hanging out with relatives who were staying at the Orleans Casino. They had other meetings to attend, so we checked out Bailiwick's brews and food. After we raved about it all and shared photos with the relatives, they went the next day and were so  happy with their experience. Another visit was during the 175th anniversary celebration of Pilsner Urquell, a Czech lager that hubby enjoys. A special keg (or kegs) was flown in and tapped for the occasion, with a lot of nice giveaways for customers.

A few nights ago, we stopped in after a concert and made it just in time to order before the kitchen closed at midnight. It was also during their "reverse social hour" (10pm to close), so we could again have the reuben eggrolls, warm salted pretzel with a cheese fondue sauce, and wings--all with frosty mugs of the Pilsner Urquell and Stella. When we got our bill, I was happily surprised that it was just a little over $40 for all the food and beer we ordered. Now that's a great happy hour! They have an earlier, typical social hour of 4pm to 6pm.

The Fab, the band that Saturday night, was so much fun, playing a mix of 60s/Beatles hits. For those who have the music in you, there's a small dance floor near the stage if you feel like shaking your booty.

Each time we've been there, the food has been hot and delicious, the brews cold and prompt, and our servers have been hard working and attentive. There are pub height tables and booths, plus a dining area if you would rather enjoy your meals with more table-top square footage. We like the appetizers/bar snacks, but there are also full meals (like pasta or even schnitzel), sandwiches, burgers, salads, soup and the like. The pub is easy to get to, especially if you park near any of the southwest corner entrances to the casino.

Let me preface the review with this: the food was good, but the service was severely lacking. Upon arrival, my group was denied seats because our reservations were overlooked. About 20 minutes later, we were provided seats in a secluded room. We were still waiting on other guests to arrive, but were then rudely told that if we did not order soon, we would then be kicked out. The waitress we had was very irritable and passive aggressive. It seemed as if she did not want to serve us, making our experience there even worse than it already was. Once we received our food we were only checked on once to order desserts prior to receiving the bill. Maybe it was an off day for the employees at the time, but the customer service should be maintained at all times. No complaints about the food, just the poor customer service.

Very clean atmosphere.  Service is the top.  Tamera at the bar is very friendly.  Food choices are healthier and flavorful than most bars.  Choices to watch sports and more. And live music! 

Drink choices are excellent! 

Definitely recommend it.

Hit Baliwick for happy hour. I was misled on my selection of beer, or I shouldn't have listened to the input of my server. I didn't enjoy it, she could probably tell because she never came back to ask if I liked it and it sat there through my entire meal. Food was decent, over priced but alright.
Ahh-mazing all around! When you walk in you completely forget your inside the Orleans.. The drinks are yummy and the food is outstanding

I can't rave enough about this place. My first time and a random stumble upon. (Background) My husband and I met at a wranglers game years ago so we always come to the orleans to start the party at the alligator bar but ended up celebrating our anniversary here!!
We had the BEST SERVICE by Tami!!!! (seriously ask to be in her section as you won't be disappointed by how spot on she is) the food was fantastic and beyond fair priced especially the alcohol!! Hats off to the entire staff, it's a hidden gem in Vegas!!!

Holy smoke!!! The blt sliders with fried green tomatoes is so delicious!! Comes with homemade potato chips and there's a live band with great music. The service is great, the food is great and the musics was fantastic!

Bailiwick replaced two previously existing restaurants and made it into one big beautifully decorated room. There is a nice little lounge area (21+) while you wait with comfy couches and a pool table. While we were they there was a great game of music bingo going on which always makes for a good time. The service itself wasn't the best. I'm not sure if they were low on servers but the guy who waited on us kept forgetting things: drinks, didn't check on us for a while, we asked him for something and he forgot again so we had to find someone else, and i think one of the managers was working on something nearby and didn't bother to jump in...so that kind of put a damper in the dinner but one of the hostesses saved the day. As for the food, it was amazing. A good variety on the menu- options for the kids who can be picky, vegan grandpa was able to eat and enjoy it, and tasty desserts for those who have a sweet tooth, like me. The little mini donuts are a must try but the graham cracker/S'mores was way too sweet. 

Overall I would recommend trying this place. Despite the bad serving experience it really is a little hidden gem inside the orleans. Plus, our server was a nice guy. Everyone has an off

Entertainment thumbs up, food so-so.

Nice atmosphere, pleasant service. Prices are fair. We liked the live music, a welcome treat. Service was solid, not spectacular.

Food? Not so great. We sent back the brisket fries. Truly inedible unless you like eating a mouthful of pure barbeque sauce. Yuck!

The duck flatbread was uninspired. Hoisin sauce too strong, the bread not good. Cheese blah, too.

We did like two things: the short rib white chili was tasty. The brussel sprout salad nicely done. That one we took home for the next day it was so good. 

To be fair, we were told the burgers were great so shame on us for not listening to our server. We'll be back to try again.

Super chill place located inside the Orleans. My boyfriend and I came here for a quick drink and ended up staying to hang out for a second drink and an appetizer. The atmosphere is awesome. Bartenders and staff are really friendly and service was great. We enjoyed the Japanese Fish Tacos. During happy hour they're only $9 for three tacos. Worth every penny!! The flavors come together beautifully! Highly recommend. We enjoyed a beer each and then the Baili-Tail Bloody Mary. Delicious! Highly recommend checking this place out. We will be back!

Since making my last review the service at the bar had taken a nose dive... all employees including managers are too busy "tasting" booze to wait on their customers... unfortunate for a Saturday night... step it up guys... ps BONES is the only person who gave any attention without being asked... thank you Bones
Came here for a snack and we got way more than that.  The food was delicious.  There was a beautiful woman singing who sounded like Adele.  She was AMAZING!!!

The food & cocktails are delicious. We had the "Not Nachos" and the Warm Pretzel. For cocktails, try the Coco Loco or Smashed.  The live music was actually very good. I sometimes avoid places with live music because it can be too loud or just not good. Neither is the case here. Definitely give this place a try!

Excellent. Good food.  I've had the Brussels sprout salad, chicken sliders, on the second pass the nachos & the pretzel. Alll very tasty.  The music is very nice different styles at different times .  The. Volume won't blow you out of the restaurant . Some of the other dishes I've seen served to other tables look awesome. When we visit LV our rule is we never go to the same restaurant twice during our stay,  this was the exception

I decided to pop in here for a leisurely dinner, i'd never been here before so i thought why not give it a whirl.

The atmosphere gave off a hip/funky type of feel- that was ok with me. I sat at the bar and since the bar area didn't have slot machines i had ample table room which i thought was comfortable.

The service in my humble opinion was attentive and professional.

When the food came, I was very pleased to see how it was presented- it was very appealing to the eye...and the stomach as the food was tasty as well.....might i suggest the garlic fries.....

The prices weren't that shocking so you can have that nice little fuzzy  feeling that what you pay for is worth it....

Give it a shot, I'm glad i did.
Fish n chips tonite not bad. Waiting for Smores skillet for dessert.  At Orleans for convention. Bailiwick was nlt here last year.  Too bad has great selections gor vegetzrian wife

Great service from hostess, server, bartender. Went on St Pattys Day they had a short wait but called us when a table was ready. The server was super nice and attentive. Food was ok. Maybe what I order just was blah. I got the fried green tomato sandwich. It just didn't work. The blu cheese fries were ok.

It has been months since I was here. Probably because to me it was a little pricey. However, I keep remembering how much I liked the food. I got fish and chips. It was excellent. Not only was the fish very good, but the chips were to die for. These are the thick, steak fry type. It is always important to me to get hot fries. The thicker ones don't cool off as quickly, and stay at the proper temperature. Maybe it was also luck that they turned out so good. In addition, the cole slaw was also a huge plus. They added green peas to the cole slaw, possibly as a nod to the traditional side dish of mushy peas that I am told they have in England instead of cole slaw. Fortunately I was not in England, because I wouldn't touch mushy peas with a ten foot pole. Cole slaw is the way to go as a side dish for fish and chips in my opinion, but the peas made it better. They serve the creamy type of cole slaw here, which is what I like.

Love the food here! The BEST burgers, perfect fries, and an excellent selection of beer. BONES is an outstanding bartender, allowing us to try various beers before choosing one. The happy hour prices definitely make this a go-to for us when we're in town. The live music is a plus, not too loud, just a compliment to the atmosphere. Highly recommended!

You know how you get that feeling you walked into wrong place on wrong night? Waited 15 min at bar to be served. Guy working bar didn't even look at me. Then another bartender came over. Very unfriendly not just to me but wait staff. Food mediocre.  Unpleasant all around. Wont be back.
Love this place, nice beer selection and some wild food choices. The staff is attentive and knows Beer.  Live music at times.  No poker machines but lots of TVs at the bar.  You will love it!

We just caught a movie at The Orleans & wanted a nightcap, so we decided to check this place out. The decor is AMAZING! The lighting is perfect and there are so many seating options...including some comfy couches & high-backed chairs. We opted for some bloody mary's...not food on this visit. They have a "social hour" from 10p-12a and there are some great deals. Our Bloody's were only 6 bucks a piece & the mix was awesome! Gene was the bartender & he did a great job. Although we didn't order any food, he answered all my questions about the menu for my future visits. The real highlight of the visit was Phil Stendek and his entertaining performance. He's on stage by himself, but it sounds as if he has a full band backing him up. He played a great mix of hip-hop, classic rock, and r&b. He peppered his performance with hilarious stories & jokes, and even gave me a shout-out! I can't wait to come back and try their menu.

Me and my cousins and my sisters had a mini family reunion there recently. The service and wait staff were excellent and always checking in on us if we needed anything and cheerful.  The food and drinks was excellent and reesonably priced and proportioned.

I went here for the first time a couple of days ago. It had a nice atmosphere to it. You walk in see the bar scene, people socializing, and playing billiards. The staff was kind and polite. The staff was also very timely and did not hover too much. There was a live band playing some rock music. The band wasn't too loud so you can socialize and they were great! The food was awesome. I ordered Reuben egg rolls for an appetizer and they were delicious! Not for people who do not like sauerkraut. I ordered the Chicken shiitake garlic noodles as my main course. It was was very good, not too overwhelming in flavor as it might sound. My cousin ordered the New England seafood roll it came out and looked very cute. It was also fully stuffed not mostly bread.
Service was excellent. Buffalo chicken sliders were slimey and uninteresting. Drinks were watery. Don't seek this place out. Karaoke while you eat is distracting.

I am so glad I stumbled upon this place the other day, amazing service and great food.! For the appetizer I tried the not your nachos which were so different in such a tasteful way. I had the cleaver salad which was delicious. Ashley was a great server, very attentive and nice. I can't wait to come back here. If you find yourself in Orleans or even looking for something to eat I can't imagine this place letting you down. Let's just say it was bomb, bomb, bomb!

The place was not packed when we walked in ask for a booth the host told us they're holding booth for people after going back and forth complaining about that she finally set us in a booth but was rude about it then our waitress came gave us our drink and took her order but never checked on us we had to ask the bartender for our check we told him nobody checked on us he said he will let the manager know we will not be going back and the food was not all that either

Love the late night happy hour 10pm to 1! $6 wine and $7 well drinks and snacks. We sat at the bar and were quickly greeted. They give you a menu as well as an iPad with the menu. The bartenders were very nice and busy, but still attentive. They have plenty of seating with games all around. There was a NFR rodeo event going on so could not walk around the whole bar.

We tried a couple drinks including a couple glasses of white wine and a muddled cranberry vodka that was delicious 5/5. For a snack before our movie we tried the Not Your Nachos which came with thick cut house made potato chips, pork chili Colorado (large pieces of meat), jack cheese, pico de gallo, guacamole and ghost chili crema. Oh my, delicious to the last bite! Definitely a 5/5. Huge pile of food with meat and cheese throughout not just on top. 

We have found a great spot to hit up before movies and to make it even better the happy hour prices made it much more reasonable.

Great atmosphere and food!  Came with a group after a kids event.  The food was great! The tween and teen got a GIGANTIC cinnamon roll!  It was awesome!  Their eyes were so big!   
We shared the chicken and waffles, ummm yeah I'll order that again!  My friends all thought their Food was delicious!   
Definitely will go back if im around that side town...  may travel across town for it!

Great addition to the Orleans! We sat at the bar and had EXCELLENT service from Bones. He's very knowledgable, friendly, and a great bartender. Food was so yummy!!! We had the Buffalo Chicken Sliders and the Fish and Chips. Probably the best fish & chips I've ever had in my life! We loved Bailiwick so much, we came back the next night for dinner.  Sat at bar again, with Bones. We had the Smoked Beef Brisket, the Margherita Flatbread, and Garlic Fries. Again, everything was SO GOOD. Mmmm, just thinking of that brisket is making me want some.

They had a great beer selection and a great whiskey selection (looks like they had a big selection of all spirits, but I only looked at the whiskey). There was live music which was great  and the whole vibe and decor there was perfect. Each staff member we encountered was very friendly. Overall, this place is super awesome and I can't wait to come back!

Thanks Bailiwick!!

This Gastropub is inside The Orleans, and we decided to stop in here for some drinks before meeting with some friends at a Chinese restaurant nearby.
It's typically quiet when you're here on a weekday afternoon/evening. They have lots of excellent drink choices in each category -- beer, wine, whatever. I think I'll try the food here next time I come around here.

This was my 3 visit to Bailiwick  I thought  it was nice and the dishes I had were good. But today will be my last visit
I was made to feel that I shouldn't be in this restaurant . The Bartender didn't seem very courteous and the manager s question to the Bartender who is this guy.
I'm African American I dress nice carry my self well and I'm a nice person. I guess
The Perception  that the Bartender and the Mgr had of me was that I was Gay . Well Yes I am 
Any ways I lost my appetite didn't finish my meal  paid my check and I left. I know their conversation wasn't my business but if someone is referring to me as a distraction and all I'm doing is eating my 
Meal . I asked one of the waiters was there a problem ?  I've worked  in customer service for 40yrs
I thought well if they wanted to know who I was they should have approached me and asked. Instead they had to reveal there ignorance stereotyping their guest
My waitress was great
But as the Bartender stated we don't want this to become a Gay Hangout
If he only knew
Some people need to grow up
It's 2017.
But the Decor and abeyance is great
If they had a inclusive and diverse
Staff they could fill the place up
I'm better now
Told my story
Peace

Been meaning to check this place out for awhile since it's new in the Orleans 

A group of us decided to go check it out after they got off work , I ordered the mule and they all ordered beers 

The mule was ok had some sort of spice in it but was ok 

They have a interesting beer selection I ordered the mango beer for my second round everyone hated it but me lol 

I also ordered the carnival items but they were delicious 

They have a live artist playing music which was nice people were dancing 

It's definitely not what you would expect to find in the New Orleans but it is a cool place

After four years, I felt no big pull to check out The Orleans (aside from this summer when everyone had Pokemon Go fever and I heard the hotel was known to be a spawning point for some rare Pokemon time and again). Bailiwick finally got me to visit the hotel while the rodeo was in town and I wanted to try something new. I really should have written this review right after my visit, but the fact that this place still leaves a very positive impression weeks after says a lot. 

Josh was my server and he was pretty funny - he had my husband cracking up every time he checked in, all while keeping my ginger ale cup flowing. We went with a lot of his suggestions - the Carnival Bites were these perfectly fried corn dogs that came with a mustard sauce. As a corn dog connoisseur, this are seriously some of the best I've had.  The sea salt and vinegar chips remind me of the Wolfgang Pick chips and dip, but less pretentious, more flavorful dip, and crispier chips. And the absolute must everyone should have here is the warm butter toffee cake. We went a bit overboard and had the apple crumble that was a rodeo menu item, but just the toffee cake by itself could have filled us up. My husband appreciated that they didn't skimp on the ice cream amount like other places tend to. The bill didn't break the bank and we played some shuffleboard after. You can tell management has put a real emphasis on service with how the staff interacts with their guests. Paired with the great food and the fact that on-strip hotels are charging for parking, I think Bailiwick will be a big locals draw and will have me coming back for more.

I attended a music festival this past weekend at the Orleans and Bailiwicks was one of the venues. The pub is new and they did a great job of expanding it and adding a stage & sound system. The bands were great, but unfortunately the service during the concerts was terrible. Bartenders were not friendly, slow, and the cocktails were pretty weak. The craft beer selection was good, offering good local beers, but unfortunately over the 5 day event customer service did not get any better, if not worse. On the last day there was actual wait staff on the floor so thought it would make the experience more enjoyable, but it did not. If anything the wait staff seemed annoyed we were there ordering drinks and trying to have a good time. I never tried the food, mostly because I really didn't want to spend any more time than needed at this location. Much friendlier staff over at the casino food court.

Omg!! Worst ever. Terrible location.  Never back again. Don't do it. Even worse they don't do to go food. They told me they would have to bring me out my food and I would have to box it up myself. I will be calling to complain asap bc nowhere on the website does it say that. The bartender ignored me for 10 minutes while serving others at the bar as well. Not worth it at all

Sat at the bar and had a few appetizers and drinks with a friend, and I have to say Bones is absolutely the most efficient bartender I have ever encountered.  I ordered the Reuben Eggrolls, and they were incredible.  Weird combo, but it works for me.  Friend had the pretzel and it was huuuge.  We couldn't finish either as they were so filling, but the drinks were generous and strong  :)  Definitely will be back to try the other interesting food items.  Does get loud when band is playing, makes it hard to talk.

Really nice venue in the Orleans. Band plays a little too loud early in the evening,  but  we're "old" & it's difficult to carry on a coversation with flourish music. Nevertheless, the band was good. 
Our server, TIA, was outstanding -& having stayed here & eaten at the Orleans in the past,  we were very impressed.
Tia was friendly & very on the ball.  She should train the servers at the breakfast cafe!
Also, kudos to Drew, great personality! the asst. server. Hey, Manager,  RECOGNIZE these workers!
Besides Alder & Birch, Bailiwicks is our new go-to when we visit Vegas.
Really nice set-up here. Up to date decor. Very clean. Food was good. Typical menu of burgers, etc. Vast selection of beers.

The food and selections of beer are great. Service with waiter John & Manager Jaynie was top notch. They only semi negative thing is the hostess & one bartender are lazy and lack customer service. I going to be eating here probably my whole stay. 


Went back because the food, atmosphere were great. Before I posted I spoke to the manger about our experience and I feel she honestly welcomed the feed back, so we had to go back tonight. It was to much fun and food was amazing. We tried 4 smaller dishes and a flat bread pizza, so we all can try more choices. We were definitely not let down. We got our drinks and cold dishes right away then the other items when we were done. The timing allowed us to stay longer and enjoy our selves on the last night in town. 

Thank you Jaynie & Bones for a great time. Don't remember waitress's name but she was good also plus food runner was nice.  Glad we were able to experience your restaurant and show you what a "Sit down with a get down" is and how some Californians get down

We have traveled to the Orleans for the West Coast Conference basketball championships for 10 years strait.  Last year, we would eat at the new Bailiwick daily. We loved the place.

We told all of our friends back home how great this place was.

This year we sat at the bar and were served by a big bear of a man. 
Seriously the guy blew us off. He had no people skills and was not interested in providing any reasonable service. 

A restaurant can have an amazing selection of beers,  a creative menu, and beautiful decor, but if employees don't like their jobs, the experience becomes ordinary. 

There are many options at the Orleans for great food experiences. 

I suggest trying any them in place of Bailiwick.

Cool place with lots of beer choices. Went few times during happy hour and every food item I had was on point , can't complain. I usually go play pool every time I go and you just need a food or beverage tap of atleast $25. My server as been JHAZMIN. She is super sexy and nice. Great place!

This place is located in the back area of The New Orleans and you may walk by it, but will advise slow down and go in. This place is such a great place for hanging out and has areas where you can go sit and enjoy their happy hour. The service was great and very attentive and I had two people come by and ask me if I was doing good and how I was doing. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and yes this soup was delicious with a slight heat and drizzled with sour cream and corn strips. For my entree had the brisket sandwich, Wow° this sandwich came hot and packed with fresh hot brisket pieces on a warm ciabiatta bread that has cheese broiled on top!!! It comes with house made butter pickles that are so look good, and house made salt and vinegar potatoes chips. I am so glad I found this place and look forward to going back on my next visit.

Oh my goodness! Ask about the portions before ordering. Unless you're hungry and claim you can eat a horse... by all means order up!

This place isn't so bad. I'm amazed with the value honestly. Like our hotdog we ordered could feed 2-3 people. The amount of food we ordered definitely could feed 3-4 people. But that's what I'm saying! We didn't know how generous the portions would be.

They've got an interesting adult drinks menu. Try to make it for happy hour. 

Our waitress was friendly and same with the manager. She came to chat with us to learn we were locals. I think they like that locals also dine out like tourists.

Nice interior design. Good location off-strip. Recommend dining here - YES!

If you enjoy great food you can't go wrong here. This place has something for every palate and I love that they're open late. Went here with a bunch of colleagues after we got hungry aftwr gambling in the hotel. We must have gotten 1 of every single appetizer. They have alot of fun non-traditional food items.

Very disappointed this time. At 9pm on a Friday there was hardly anyone dining (just 2 other tables) and a few people sitting at the bar. We weren't greeted when we walked in and waited 10 minutes just standing there before I asked a bartender if we should seat ourselves (though 3 bartenders with an almost empty bar did not acknowledge us and a reception desk with a sign to wait!) I asked for a "spicy" bloody mary and couldn't taste any spice, none....natta! In fact I think it was just tomato juice and olives! I boasted about the reuben egg rolls last time but these were soooo greasy and did not enjoy them. The bbq chicken flat bread pizza was tough to chew and really not flavorful. The Chicago dog was okay, the hot dog was good but the bread tasted borderline stale. Food did come out fast. Service was minimal. Sad to say Fridays "bar food" (which is right across the casino floor) is much better especially the bbq chicken flatbread pizza. Very disappointed and will not be returning.

Took more time than i expected once i was seated to see a waiter. Ordered a bloody mary, i asked if it wad good, they said yes. It was ok. Had to ask for more lemon. Ordered the seafood rolls by advice of the bartender in front of me. The menu description is by far better than what you get. You get 3 small rolls with a seafood mixture that is not chunky or freash.
Stopped in for a snack before heading home. Really nice place. Live music was awsome and our server Jhazmin was super friendly.

This is a fun, lively and upbeat bar/restaurant located in the Orleans Hotel and Casino.  There is a bar area and an area with tables and chairs.    There are pool tables and comfortable couches and chairs in the front as you walk in.  A large variety of beers on tap.  It was very busy and we waited awhile for our server to come over to see if we wanted a second round of beers.  We also ordered food.   When we went over to the bar and tried to order our second round, the bartender told us we had to wait and order through our server.   I thought this was a little odd.  Other than that, the food and drink was great.  We got the ready to eat shrimp which came with dipping sauces (honey mustard, cocktail sauce, and a southwest sauce ).  We also got the house made salt and vinegar chips that came with a bleu cheese dipping sauce.  There is a live band every night and the band Thursday night sang a variety of tunes and were quite good.   A nice place to gather with friends and have a variety of beers and good bar food.
Very good food and atmosphere! Mark is super duper over the top awesome guy and Jaynee is totally awesome! Sthooo Good!!   I recommend to all friends and family over 21, Great flight. No turbulence!!

Stopped in here after a movie and wish we didn't have to leave. The new Bailiwick is an updated, elevated bar. The lighting, wall decor, and new seating takes it to a whole new level. 

We decided to sit at the bar because we like chatting with bartenders. The iPads used for menus are really a cool idea but I find it wasn't entirely user friendly and the one my boyfriend had was stuck on a very dim screen that couldn't be fixed. 

I started off with a glass of wine and he ordered a flight of beer. For food, we ordered the grilled cheese sliders and tomato soup to start. I loved the little sliders. They're so cute and the perfect size for dipping. The tomato soup was very robust too and perfectly compliment the buttery salty sliders. Next, we ordered the ham and cheese flatbread with blue cheese, arugula, prosciutto, with the fig preserves on the side. This was my choice and we almost ordered a second one because it was so delicious! I got the fig preserves on the side because I'm not exactly the biggest fan of preserves to begin with and I was afraid it would overpower the flatbread if it was too sweet. We added the preserves at our discretion and it was perfect to add for just a touch of flavor. 

The live music was great! The guy on guitar was an awesome one-man-band and had us entertained the whole time while he did acoustic rap and Latin songs.

I have to also notate my experience with Joseph the bartender. He's also a Sommelier and I sell wine as a second business so we had a great discussion talking wine, food, and all of his life experience. He was so much fun to talk to. We will definitely be back for the food and for Joseph!

Typical sports bar at a casino. Plenty of TVs and 40 beers on tap. Beer is fine but nothing worth venturing to the Orleans for. They do have an ok Happy Hour and live music many nights of the week, but unless you're staying at the hotel, there are better bars in town and even right across the street.

SUGAR SUGAR SUGAR

If you like LOTS of sugar in your food, go there.  

Wrapped Dates.  Blasted with a thick maple glaze that was just over whelming. Nice portion size but just way to sweet.

Brisket Fries.  Very little beef and a ton of sweet, sticky, sugary BBQ sauce.  

New England Seafood Roll.  Three small rolls with approx 2 teaspoons of filling,   Toasted rolls were not fresh.

Garlic Fries.  You could smell them 10 feet away from table.  More garlic then you would need on 5 orders.  

Margherita Flatbread.  The best of all dishes.  Simple, Nice portion.

Atmosphere.  Band was OK.  Ask to put a specific game on TV next to pour table and the waitress came back ans said "we are trying not to accommodate specific sporting events as we don't really want to be a sports bar."  As we got ready to leave they changed the channel from music videos to a sporting event!

It was Saturday night at 8PM.  Place was empty.  I think they need to make some serious adjustments to the menu.  Lighter, healthier tapas.  I just don't think making everything so sweet will fly.  Sweet is not  flavor.  It's a cover-up.   They have some interesting items on the menu, but the recipes need some serious adjustments.

And if you are a local using comp points, they must not be a "casino owned" restaurant as I was charged full amount off my points rather than the 40% discount the program allows for,

Had the black bean burger for the first time ever and it was pretty good. Going towards the end of the burger it was getting dry but the tomatoes saved the burger. They also had a live band that made the atmosphere feel better. Will I have black bean burger again? Yes. Will I come back? Yes. 

The only reason why I gave this place 4 stars is because the waitress kept giving us this "wtf" look every time we asked for something.
Cool place with lots of different seating for all occasions. Service was alittle blah but it was late soooo I'll let it go. The food was bomb.com! I'll be coming here again for sure.

This place was amazing. It had a great, relaxed atmosphere with live music and pool tables. The decorations are fantastic especially for a restaurant in a casino. The food was delicious. Each item I ordered had a delicious twist to some of my favorite foods. The toffee cake literally melted in my mouth. The two appetizers we ate were the eggs and bacon and the poutine fries both were tasty and unique compared to anything I have ever tasted. The cocktails were excellent with the perfect mixture of fruits and alcohol. Pricing was fair for the quality of food we ate. Five stars for thinking outside the box, having an amazing atmosphere, and a friendly staff.

Had a totally enjoyable dinner at Bailiwick the night before leaving LV.  
Ordered the Fish & Chips.  Loved that: 
1) The fish pieces were thicker than typical.  Best meat::breading ratio than any other fish and chips I've had.
2) The slaw had peas in it.  I thought this was odd at first.  But it was delicious.
3) Steak Fries were big, serious, and delicious.
4) Iced Tea was good and the awesome server kept it refilled.  I probably had 5 refills.  (LV makes me thirsty!  I feel like I'm always slightly dehydrated here.) 
5) 3 sauces on the side in little ramekins made it all nice and orderly. (vinegar, tartar sauce, ketchup)
6) Comfy chairs at the round tables   Many bars have hard-a** wooden chairs.  After standing / walking all day, I was gratefully for the cushion.

Was too hungry to take a pic of the food, but did take a pic of the singer that appeared.  Great voice and very pleasant way to end the dinner.

Very cute little place & great to sit with friends off to  the side of the bar.  
So why three stars? Th beverages were bitter.  We tried 5 standard drinks...all had to be returned.  Secondly, the staff were devoid of any personality, lack of follow up and unfriendly.  We had a total of three different wait staff encounters, and they must be all miserable.
I wouldn't suggest going here...and if you do keep the expectations at a minimum.

These guys have a great atmosphere and a decent, for Vegas, taplist.  However, don't treat this place like it's the best bar for a game.  They have a great set-up, but they need to get their act together when it comes to control over their tvs.  They took forever in getting a game going for us in the first place, and then randomly changed it in the middle of play and couldn't get it going again for about 10 minutes.  If you want to be a sports bar, you need to better satisfy the sports watchers.  Otherwise, just turn off the tvs.

Stopped by here for dinner on our first night in Las Vegas and what an excellent experience it was. Cool atmosphere, great music, excellent service and delicious menu. Even the handcrafted drinks were super delicious. Our waitress (I think it was maybe Tina?) made some excellent recommendations so we started with her favorite dish, the brisket fries. The bbq sauce with the sweet chips were quite a delight! Followed it up with a burger with a fried egg, goat cheese, and pesto cooked perfectly to my liking and a side of their house made pickle. Can you say yum? And then to finish up for the night we ordered the donuts. I felt like I could bathe in the dipping sauces and die happy (especially the salted caramel one). This spot is off the beaten path but totally worth a try. I will definitely be coming back next time I am in Vegas.

Killing time waiting on a movie we wandered into Bailiwick. Quiet Tuesday evening with lots of table and servers. They were just starting music Bingo which was free for diners. We had fun playing and they took a pic of us. My friend ordered chicken tortilla soup which she liked and said would order it again. I ordered a pile of shrimp  with three sauces. It was good and I felt I got my money's worth. We both really liked the coffee.

Decor is nice, friendly staff. We had a large group and we had nice room that was separate from the main dining area. It had 2 big screens and comfortable chairs. Tia, our waitress, was great and very patient with us. The food was delicious from the apps to the mains. The Chef came out to see how everything was and seeing if we needed anything else which I thought was very nice of him. He even brought out a special plate for my cousin :)

The reason for the 3star...the drinks were mediocre.   They were not worth $11+ at all. They need to rethink about their bartender! 

Definitely come here for the food! Not so much for the drinks.

Just like 3 stars, this experience was average. There was not one single thing that made me to want to go back. The service, food and price were all "okay". 
We had the large pretzel app and it was just a pretzel served with plain mustard. My club style sandwich was good and the fries were normal fries similar to Wendy's fries in shape and taste. 
Service was as expected nice and checked back. You know nothing to go on about. 
The only thing that was bad which is no fault of the restaurant was there was a large family with unhappy kids sitting next to us. Oh and it was someone's birthday who they never noticed didn't even arrive. It was quite something. " Happy Birthday! Where is she?" I about died.

Great food, music, and service!   I recently celebrated my birthday here.  They (management, Megan, and John) were exceptionally accommodating with my reservation.    The menu is diverse and everyone enjoyed their food: tortilla soup, nachos, flatbread, burgers, chicken and French toast, schnitzel, and Ruben eggrolls were all hits with our group.  They offer lighter fares with a variety of soups and salads.  It was a great dinner followed by fun with The Spazmatics' performance.  They made sure that everything was taken care of for my event and made it a memorable evening!
This is a nice bar and part of Orleans' stepping it up.  I understand why they open at 4:00, but would not mind an earlier opening time.  Service has been good and so is their pricing!

The menu is amazing!! Joshua was great and chef Moe was super friendly! Had the Bailiwick burger - so good!!! Probably the most affordable, nice/elegant restaurant I experienced this trip to Vegas! Cheers!!!!

One of my favorite spots. Ive been here a few times for trivia night Wednesdays and late happy hour. the service is good, there are a variety of bands that play here , and the food does not dissapoint! So i believe they have a great way to entertain guests, but are underappreciated. Maybe a lot of people dont know that the Orleans has had a retouch. Every time I come this place could be fuller. Come! This place has a lot of liquor to choose from, great bar bites, amd entertainment. My favorites are the reuben eggrolls and New England seafood rolls.

Food is unique with a twist which is cool and different.  Great selection of beers from all over in both draft and bottles. Music is cool to sit back and nice to hear a real person rather than a recording.  Staff is friendly and offers suggestions. Overall cool decor will be back

I come to New Orleans quit often to watch movies, and I always walk by this place. It's definitely an eye catching restaurant. It has a little bit of everything. So I came here for the first time with friends and it was great. I ordered the chicken & French toast and it was AMAZING!!! And I highly recommend trying it. Better than waffles. Even the syrup was perfect! I would definitely come back for more!

I am so excited that this place exists! Prices are insane and the food is just as incredible. It's like a combo of Culinary Dropout and a touch of Hearthstone but much softer prices and bigger portions. Everything's house made and you can taste it. As a craft cocktail and food snob I can tell you this is the place to be! The Potato and Leek soup was one of the best things I ever ate. The Halibut fish and chips were huge and tasty (for $16!). The Duck flatbread is a generous and well developed salty flavor and the Ruben egg rolls were in point. Awesome HH and cocktails are cheap and boozy! Just come here with a big group so you can try more food because their options are generous for being shared plates style. Enjoy!

Beautiful restaurant. Great bites to share and even the Chef came out to say hi. Was a wonderful experience. Ashley the server was really sweet and I didn't catch the busser's name but on point as well. The chicken and waffles was amazing savory and sweet. My nephew ordered the bailey burger and the flavor of the cheese and aioli was outstanding. My sister in law ordered the nachos which were huge and it was no ordinary nachos. Potato chips made in house topped with tender awesome carnitas and sauces with a fresh tasty guac. Pretty awesome. Grab a few things to share and enjoy.

This place put The Orleans back on the Map for me. The Craft Beer selection and constantly revolving Taps are amazing. This place has a solid beer program and I wish more restaurants would be influenced by this. Also the Barrel Aged Cocktails here are superb, the Old Fashioned is my Jamm right now and their Barrel Aged version is on point! The food here is 10 steps above good bar food, it's outstanding Bar Food and the Bartender, Bones, is such a knowledgeable, happy guy! Thank you for outstanding service, fun conversations and great personality, we'll come back soon on your shift, you rock man! This place does also have live music, it's a small little venue but super loungy with great seating the band Stoked we saw last week really rocked, I felt they belonged on a bigger stage as they sounded larger then life. The sound quality and acoustics really are good for inside a casino restaurant. This place makes me want to come to the Orleans more often.

Before a play, I stopped here and used a dining comp.  I was seated in the lounge area which was fine because there was no music at the earlier hour and it was very comfortable seating.  I also got to order off the social hour (commonly known as happy hour) menu.

Wendy was my server and she was a good help.  I asked her about ordering some things, one of which was going to be the poutine.  She recommended skipping the poutine as it was a large dish more likely to be shared.  Instead she gave me some options.  I ordered the carnival bites--their take on corn dogs--and the goat cheese.

I was brought my iced tea quickly and their was a young bus person who continually refilled the tea for me.The carnival bites are good but what makes them good is the honey mustard for dipping the pieces of sausage.  The menu says they're dipped in corn dog batter.  I could discern no flavor from the batter.  The goat cheese was a baked piece of cheese in San Marzano tomato sauce with toast pieces to spread the cheese and tomato sauce on.  Both dishes were OK but the best was yet to come.

For dessert, I got the toffee pudding.  A very nice piece of cake with toffee around the base topped with ice cream and a chocolate stick.  This was very good and was a light ending to the dinner.

The restaurant was quite empty most of the time I was there.  

Location in the casino is where Brendan's Irish Pub and the Asian restaurant next to Brendan's.    It's a large space.
Food great. Drinks great. Music great. Atmosphere great. Band great. Nothing but positive experience both times I've been to Bailiwick.
Great place to hang out for live music and to play pool. The service was amazing. They have a blueberry martini that is very yummy. The Ruben egg rolls are a must try.

The food was good and the atmosphere was awesome.... I've been going to the orleans for years but in recent times haven't gone. I was surprised with the upgrades. If you are in the orleans hotel and casino this is a good place to have a drink and the food is good too

Given this place 3 tries because good location and nice decor. I had the bacon wrapped dates which were good but the bartenders are pretty incompetent, they have no clue what the menu is every time I come in, so that shows me it's super inconsistent service, also THE GOD DAMN APPETIZERS ARE THE SAME PRICE AS THE BURGERS AND SANDWICHES!! That's just foolish business 101. Will never be back

Good local draft beer selection and food/snacks available. Bartenders are knowledgable about beer and friendly. Pool tables. Open seating areas. Dance floor. Live music. This night was a small acoustic group singing todays hits with a twist.

Early and late happy hour. $2 off beer coupon in the Orleans room key packet.

Great meal now the 3rd time this week during our stay here at the Orleans. Had the Rueben egg rolls (not bad) Schnitzel. Excellent!! I'm German and make this all the time. Yum!!! Never thought of lingonberries with it. My husband had the pile of shrimp. Excellent! He then ordered the pretzel. Wow. See picture and it was great!! The waitress Tami is the best. Highly recommend this place. It's the best restaurant here at the Orleans.

The food sounded good but we never got a chance to order it... after the not-so-friendly waitress practically tossed ONE digital menu at our party of 5, we ordered waters to drink while perusing the menu. After melting for about 10 minutes (A/C wasn't working all that well), we gave up and left. Water-less.

So the food was okayyyyy.... But the fact that it was just okayyy and our waitress ( Ashley) had the attitude of a sad robot, made our time at the table unbarable. Killed our happy vibe. Won't return.
A great find inside the Orlando casino. Great service at the stylish bar. Highly recommend the Japanese fish tacos and the potato and leek chowder. Definitely worth a visit.

Totally awesome surprise to find this place inside The Orleans! Great Craft Beers and Happy Hour is the BOMB! Can not go wrong! Ahi Tacos, Pork Nachos, Flatbreads, and the EGGROLLS!!! YES!!! Everything on the menu is amazing! Live Music, Buzztime Trivia, TV's everywhere and deelishious food!!! - oh and my FAV bartender BONES!!!  Keep on keeping on! Wed is now live trivia night as well!  I highly recommend giving this place a look!  Keepin it real and loving it!

I actually really enjoyed this place. The whole restaurant's layout is awesome, with pool tables in the front, side booths, tables near the stage (where there are live bands throughout the week!) and the cool, illuminated bar in the middle. They have a decent happy hour, which my date took advantage of ordering the Bailiwick burger while I had the fish n chips (not on happy hour). The only draw back was the burger was clearly rare, bleeding on the plate when he ordered it medium well, but at least they brought a brand new one to resolve the issue. The fish n chips was the best I've ever had, surprisingly. The cod melted in my mouth, and had good clean flavor. They serve with it steak fries which were also satisfying, and coleslaw with bacon bits which was also tasty. 

The service was on point :) I also loved the entertainment, it set such a laid back mood. 

All-in-all, good experience. Would go again.
Fantastic new bar at the Orleans. Great to see a band here seating is excellent has a dance floor nice stage tons of drinks and food.

Bailiwick promotes itself as the Orleans hub of bites, sips, and sounds. Located by the Orleans west Tropicana Avenue-facing entrance in the former Brandon's and Asian restaurant, Bailiwick is a 9,700 square foot gastropub and entertainment venue. This past week when we spent a week in the New Orleans west of the Strip, we'd visit Bailiwick for bites, sips, and sound.

Taking into account that this is a review based on my experience, I would to give my three cents in on a trend that I don't particularly care for. That trend is detheming unique and entertaining places such as parts of the Orleans. It has been brought to my understanding that the restaurants that the Orleans have been replacing are (supposedly) out of date. I beg to defer. The (supposedly) out of date restaurants that included Brandon's were upbeat places that tied in with the New Orleans theme. Now I will throw my ten cents in. I feel that Bailiwick would be a better gastropub if it had incorporated its industrial, gritty, and millennial environment into an updated New Orleans theme. Now I will give my $25 worth, which was around the price of the dinner writing on my experience at Bailawick.

The first time I set eyes on Bailiwick was when we waited for the Orleans shuttle. The Orleans is promoting this newly opened gastropub to the degree of placing a large Bailiwick sign at the west Tropicana Avenue facing entrance. This caught our attention. 

  Inside the faux city of New Orleans the hub of bites, sips, and sounds is right up the carpeted walkway from the jazzy amorphous alligator statues. The first thing that caught my eyes is the perimeter industrial sash windows fronting an industrial interior. When I left New Orleans and walked inside the gastropub, I felt that I was entering a nightclub more than a gastropub. Maybe it was the leather couches, stage, pool tables, shuffleboard table, black warehouse ceiling, and creme colored floor tiles. Being in the moment, I took in the attention to detail. Right after I stepped inside I noticed the way the center square shaped bar creates a focal point for the far end stage. I likewise felt the positive energy of the New Orleans themed casino permeating the room.

Bailiwick prides itself on being a hub of sips. It is my understanding that their beer selection serves approximately forty different draft beers. In addition to beer, the bar serves cocktails, spirits, and all sorts of booze. However, I teetotaled on this visit opting for a soda.

Bailiwick also prides itself as a hub of bites. By definition a gastropub is a pub that also specializes in good food. Their menu features seven categories of food including sandwiches & sliders, flatbreads, craft burgers and dogs, large plates, and masterful bar and table snacks. From the large plates section I ordered a fish and chips. Speaking of large, in only a couple of months it had a large price increase from $16 to $18. To be honest, $18 is on the pricey side for gastropub fish & chips. Then again you live once. I enjoyed the Alaskan halibut fish and chips. There were three patties on the plate that shared space with fries, malt vinegar, tarter sauce, and pea salad. The pea salad tasted similar to cole slaw. Throughout the meal, the waitress was on the ball with topping off the soda.

Bailiwick finally prides itself as a hub of sounds. Under the dimness of the artisan glass pendant lights, at the beginning of dinner we heard a duo on stage performing soft rock songs. They are one of a few performers that take to the stage every night. It is a stage that is contiguous to the room of hickory table tops and near the hickory wood central rectangular bar.

When I left the gastropub then made my way back into New Orleans, I had a few post dinner thoughts regarding Bailiwick. In my opinion based on first hand experience dining in the new Copper Whisk Cafe, I prefer that Orleans dining option as a hub of bites and sips. However, I say this with a capital "H," if I am in the mood for an alcohol drink or in a socializing situation such as a Yelp UYE, I prefer Bailiwick as my Orleans hub of bites, sips, and sound. My ultimate thought was that the Orleans needs to stop their gradual destruction of a unique and entertaining New Orleans meets Vegas theme by detheming areas of the hotel in the so-called name of progress. Instead the Orleans ought to replace the older restaurants with more improved and contemporary restaurants that complement the New Orleans meets Vegas theme. If that was the case with Bailiwick, I might of given an extra star for creating a unique and charming experience.

I ate here twice during my stay at the Orleans hotel.  It had a cool look to it and being a gastropub, I knew it was right up my alley.  The 1st night I ordered a Manhattan and some poutine.  The Manhattan was on point and the poutine was pretty decent.  The poutine had the beef debris, cheese curds, gravy and a fried egg on top of a bed of fries.  Everything  was great except the fries themselves tasted like they came out of a bag of Ore-Ida in the frozen food section.  

The 2nd night I came in for a few drafts and a margherita flatbread pizza.  The pizza was awful as it was doughy, flimsy and not cooked all the way.  I should have sent it back because it tasted microwaved.

I say all of this but the place itself is cool.  The bar is nice and there are a ton of TV's to check out the game of your choice.  The drinks are good, the service is on point and they have a ton of fun things to do like trivia, sports radio shows and other fun things.  I may have just picked a few bad items on the menu but if I was every back in the place, I'd probably just stick with the drinks.
Amazing food! Josh was awesome.  Chef Mo is fabulous! This newest addition to The Orleans is the best. Loved the Bali-tail Bloody Mary with sculpin!

Why bother leaving reviews on any restaurant in Vegas anymore?. None of them really give a shit about customer service or reviews.  And Bailiwick is no exception. 45 minute wait when half the tables are empty, 18 minutes for someone to even approach our table to say hello, 14 minutes to get water and another 45 minutes to get horrible food. Not one person who works there cares about their job and everything is too much of an effort. But, this is Vegas where they cater to fat, lazy tourists and local old people. 

I wish I could recommend another place to eat in the area, but they are all the same. No one cares about service or quality in this shitty town.
Great food and beer. Great band playing 80's music. I would recommend this place when in the area.

I'm in love with this place. We were only in Vegas for 3 days and we chose to eat here twice. The portions are big the prices were small and the service was great. There was live entertainment that made my friends and I stay another hour. When we return to Las Vegas ( it'll be soon )we'll be sure to stop by.
Love Bailiwick. Our 2nd visit.  Live music that rocks and amazing food! Cocktails fantastic! So glad we found this place!

This is an awesome newly remodeled bar and restaurant located inside the Orleans Casino! They have excellent food and service. There is live music, but it isn't too loud and overbearing. I tried the Baili-Blu cocktail- these things are dangerous! They go down so easy that you forget there's alcohol in them. We came here for happy hour, so we tried the baked goat cheese. If you love goat cheese, this is the dish for you. It came with toasted bread and sauce for dipping. The Ruben eggrolls were also tasty and definitely a unique choice.

Visited on a busy Sunday afternoon as a local, to enjoy their Happy Hour menu and large craft beer selection.  An off the menu Belching Beaver Peanut Butter Milk Stout (bottle) was requested and fulfilled by an accommodating  bar tender. I ordered a very interesting item; Reuben Eggrolls with a mustard-like sauce I THINK, either way it was good. Attentive staff and very clean. Music...meh, but it's free.
Excellent service! Jhaznin was our server and was amazing. Great food, beer, and band. Nice new place for the orleans!

While enjoying the music at Viva we decided to stop in for more musical entertainment inside the Bailiwick, once again another great addition to the Orleans Hotel.
