Nice place to relax & enjoy bands. Food is good we decide to split a burger while watching the band that was playing we had a nice time here very enjoyable clean place with a fun vibe!

Very nice restaurant/pub. Great setup with pool tables and shuffle board. We had a pretzel to start with a mustard and cheese sauce, real good. We then got a duck flatbread was real good. The best of course was desert we did the donuts with three sauces. 

Great Job Wendy! Super friendly and knowledgeable.

The food was good, got sushi and a meal. Wanted to try everything so our party tried everyone's food. The shrimp Pad Thai was very well seasoned. The coffee was some of the best I've had in Vegas. The reason it isn't five stars for me was the portion and price was on the higher side, yes I know it's Vegas but it was a good meal.

Great place. Truly impressed. They are firing on all cylinders. Walk in, the ambiance is inviting the decore is nice. Clean resteraunt. Our waitress Tami was amazing, absolute sweetheart. Ordered some drinks, well made right amount of liquor didn't try to short pour. Food was great. Menu on the small side but I always like that actually I feel like the kitchen has more control over what they are putting out if the menu is simple. Will return again and again as long as they continue to impress. Oh yeah there was a band there. Play good music some corny jokes lol but never-the-less a nice experience overall

Love, love, LOVE this place!
My husband and I like to go here on Sunday early evening's. We always get the hard-boiled eggs and a burger with fries. Those deviled eggs are to die for and the burgers are fantastic! My husband says the garlic fries are his favorite. Service is always friendly and fast. However, what keeps us coming back is the entertainment! All four times we have been there there has been a couple on stage singing covers of everything from The Gorillaz to the Beetles. So great!
If you are reading this review and have never been to Bailiwick... GO!

Located inside the Orleans, this place has a great atmosphere. There's a lounge section, a section with pool tables, the bar and dining room. On certain nights there's live music also. I settled on the club sandwich with sliced rotisserie chicken, bacon, cheese, lettuce and tomato. The meat was very juicy and flavorful, bacon was sliced thick, fresh bread. I wasn't a fan of the "chips" that came with it, so swap those out. Service was off this night. Our server wasn't very attentive and I noticed that we didn't have the proper table settings as the other tables and patrons did. That was irritating.

Super delicious Brussels sprouts salad. The dressing is a bit heavy in portion, however tastes so good that it's not a problem and more filling fast.
We shared the nachos and were surprised they were potato chips instead of nachos, however they were good as well. I tried a bite of the "mo burger", and as someone whom runs an American restaurant myself thought it was excellent.
Staff is very nice there and we had an enjoyable experience.

First time there, very impressed with the menu items, very different selections and reasonably priced. Great atmosphere and our server Tia was terrific.  Had the chicken and French toast and would highly recommend.

The Service was very good and attentive. The food however was mediocre. They have decent prices and a great atmosphere with a pool table. It's a fun place to hang out but I wouldn't expect too much from the food which I was disappointed and since menu looked excellent.
Great little place at the Orleans Casino and not pricey!
BONES IS THE MAN! We had a blast at this cute new bar! Love the mules and the service and love music! We'll be back soon! Wondering if they have a Sunday NOLA style jazz brunch ??

Decor is on point!  The atmosphere inside is a cozy ambience and laid back.  Balliwick provides one with a nod to classic bar Food in a comfortable setting. Perfect for kicking back with a drink and appetizers as my guests and myself did the last two Star Wars movies. Yes, here they have a full bar, pleasant staff- yet waitress service is not attentive.  Quicker service can be had at the bar, which has a more experienced staff. 
That corner area with the sofas and chairs is a great spot.  One is provided with games, connect four turned out to be the favorite of our group. My favorite- people watching since we had a wrap around of glass.  Listen people, it's Vegas;)
Let me suggest my favorite appetizer, which make note please- I don't share it.  It mine, all mine to digest- the chips.  I order a side of blue cheese and proceed to devour!

This is one of my absolute favorite places to go for dinner and drinks. They usually have live music that really adds to the atmosphere and the food is absolutely delightful! The drinks are yummy and the staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The seafood chowder and Coco Loco are my favorite things to get, but you really can't go wrong.

Stopped here for some apps and drinks on our way to a movie. The food was tasty and reasonably priced. Pleasantly surprised to see they have a nice stage with live music. Keep the band with Tommy, they play great mash-ups!
Great beer selection, nice atmosphere, good menu. Don't let the location fool you, this is high end without the price.

Went in there on Feb 11 after the NPC show at the Orleans.  Considering its in the middle of a casino I  found the prices to be very reasonable. We went for a bunch of appetizers like their garlic fries, salt and vinegar chips and deviled eggs with bacon. Everything was pretty good.  Nothing amazing but good.
Also ordered poutine and nachos.  The nachos looked a bit of a mess to eat but I was told they tasted good.  The poutine was ok but I'm not sure why they decided to put it under the salamander burning some of the fries.
All in all I'd probably go back to sample some other dishes and if they're good maybe they get an extra star.

The food, music, featured draft beer and waitresss Tia were all awesome. Lettuce cups, fish and chips, sausage flat bread, and toffee cake with a rum sauce are great choices should you go there. Wasatch Belgian beer, too.

Cool gastropub in the casino with happy hour and lots of rotating taps.  They have happy hour deals on drinks and food.  The bartenders are very helpful with picking out a drink.  Lots of seating though it did fill up during meal times for regular grubbing and drinking.  Theres a stage also with live music at times.
The food and service were excellent!! Good prices too!! The pretzel serves two easy. sweet potatoes are delicious!

Best wedge salad I have had. Good high quality food. Great beer
Great band playing too. 
I don't understand why so few people. I guess the word is not out yet.
Orleans casino great food is here.
Try the steak fritia great steak with big steak fries.
Great all around food deal . Superior service. Just amazing.

Breaded Goat Cheese appetizer was good. Sandwiches were average at an average price...nothing to write home about. It's an attractive gastropub, but the service is pretty lacking. Waitress forgot my cocktail. A couple of servers wore sagging pants with ripping shirts. Might be an ok place to go for an appetizer and drink in the bar, but skip the meal.

Hidden gem inside Orleans Casino. Poutine was great starter, Big Mo Burger blew away high dollar spots on Strip and Fish and Chips was spot on. Staff was extremely freindly and they have live music. Must try for locals.

One of my new favorite places in town. They have a great selection of craft beers, and excellent food. The meatloaf ciabatta is delicious and I could smell the garlic fries from the kitchen before they brought them to the table. (They were amazing as well.) They have live music almost every night, and it's really great.

When you go check it out, ask for Jhazmin. Great service and she made sure we all had a great time. 

I'll definitely be back again soon.

Delicious apps and meals. There were many creative offerings. We enjoyed Reuben Egg rolls, Lettuce Veggie Wraps, Garlic Fries, Shortrib Chili, homemade potato chips, and the largest pretzel I have ever seen.  Everything was quite good. I forgot to take photos until we were already halfway through some things. Try them out.

The service is ok, but the food is no good!! The place is deceiving, as well as the description of the food. It's nothing like the way they make it sound. I do not recommend this place. I love love love nachos, you can't really make bad nachos....well they did. They figured how to make bad nachos. $14 for nachos and so was not worth it. Friends got the ribs and were disappointed, pretzel was very dry. I don't recommend it at all!!

Fantastic live music in the bar area most nights is always . It has a sophisticated and comfortable industrial look with stark shapes in the lighting. I've had sandwiches and appetizers and not one was bad. They have of the best meat lovers pizzas I've had in a long while. You can't go wrong with garlic fries, get the spicy aioli on the side. The island bar is beautiful and has outlets and USB ports for your electronics. Gene is the best bartender. His recommendations were perfect. Ashley warmed up as we spoke beer terminology. Dragon's Blood stout, La Fin du Monde, Mother Earth Sin Tax Peanut Butter stout, Double Bastard and a ton of other beers are so delicious that you might as well get a room. The hours are a little odd but they do have happy hour drinks and food items.
Bailiwick is great. Our server, Tia, was attentive and funny.  I LOVE the smoked brisket sandwich, my husband enjoyed his burger. We will be back!!

First time here, came for a family members Birthday. We shared a Pretzel and the Reuben Egg Rolls which were amazing. Tia our server was wonderful , very friendly and made great suggestions. I had the Chicken and French Toast. We were all very happy and will be back for sure. I want to check out their live music.

I wanted to like this place because it had so much potential. However, my every visit was always lackluster. 

Food always averaged from 3 to 4 out of five. One of our favorites was the sliders with French Toast and fried chicken sliders, but now it's not on the menu anymore. At least, not when we visited there. We also like getting new entrees there and is always a bit disappointed with the taste. Food like brisket fries is something you should probably want to skip. It hardly had any brisket and the fries is chips. WTF. Not a fan. 

The only thing I liked about this place is the entertainment. They always have locals playing amazing music there which heighten the ambiance. But overall, the service is always a miss. The servers take forever to refill your drinks, and you will hardly see them until it's time to pay the bill. Even when you want to pay the bill, it seems like they want to keep you waiting. I'm not sure if they're just understaffed or they need more training, but that's more damage to my experience. Never coming back.
